description.narrative: The aim of this programme is to support the Government of Sierra Leone (GoSL) to reduce maternal, neonatal and under-5 mortality and morbidity by increasing utilisation of quality Reproductive, Maternal, Neonatal, Child and Adolescent Health (RMNCAH) services. This will be achieved through a multifaceted approach to strengthen quality, expand access, and build the demand for RMNCAH services in Sierra Leone.

activity-date.narrative: CUAMM- DOCTORS WITH AFRICA UNITE FO SEV LAYF NA SALONE – ACTIVITY SUMMARY QUARTERLY REPORT QUARTER THREE – JULY – SEPTEMBER, 2019 MAIN ACTIVITY COMPLETED DURING THE QUARTER ACHIEVEMENT • Coordination of health partners meeting • Six District Health Partners Coordination meeting were conducted during this quarter (3 in Bonthe and 3 in Pujehun). Action points has been developed during this meeting and acted on accordingly within time line set with responsible person. • Support to PUH In charges Meting • CUAMM in collaboration with DHMT completed six monthly PHU in-charges meeting (3 in Bonthe and 3 in Pujehun) with data presentation. • Training on Patograph and discussion of action points of maternal death that has relevance to the in charges meeting was reinforced during the meetings. • Maternal death Investigation • Bonthe and Pujehun had three & four maternal deaths this quarter. Line listing & Investigation were done to ascertain causes of all deaths in Pujehun and 1 in Bonthe. Two of the deaths were not investigated in Bonthe as there were very hard to reach deaths communities in the Island. However, modalities have been put in place by both CUAMM and DHMT to conduct the investigation in early part of next quarter. • Maternal deaths review Meetings completed with action points • Maternal death review meetings on the afro mention deaths was done for three deaths in Pujehun and one in Bonthe. Action points to mitigate future causes of deaths were outlined by MDSR committee in both district and are closely followed up with appropriate time line • Community feedback meeting was done in collaboration with DHMT and Restless Development. Community Feedback meeting on 3 maternal deaths that were reviewed in Pujehun and one in Bonthe was done during the quarter. Community and family members were told about the delays that resulted to the deaths of the deceases. • Support to development of standard operating procedures (SOPs) • This quarter, Bonthe government hospital Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) on fuel management for hospital generator was finalised and validated by both Medical Superintendent of the hospitals. The remaining SOP on HR, Equipment’s and hospital procedure is under review by both CUAMM and Hospital Management. • Non-financial incentives for best performing health facilities on a pre-agreed criterion with the DHMT • Non-financial motivation awards for hard working facility and staff was done in Bonthe. Presentation was done to 6 best performing PHUs that proved best in four criteria set up by DHMT. Criteria set was to serve as a driver on improvement in data quality and punctuality of PHU staff to work. Pujehun also did similar activity during the quarter and 5 different PHU among 84 health facilities benefited from the Award. • Integrated Supportive supervision and other supervisions • Pujehun did ISSV visit with check list to 45 health facilities during this quarter. • 21 facilities out of 64 facilities in total was supervised under supportive supervision on data audit using check list in Bonthe. • Support to Pediatrics and obstetric referrals • In Collaboration with DHMT, CUAMM continued to multiply copies of available existing referrals forms for both obstetric and pediatric referrals to 12 CHCs in Pujehun and 5 CHCs in Bonthe on need basis. Technical coaching was given to 7 CHC SLiSL II facilities on how to properly fill referral documentation for both obstetric and pediatrics referrals done to the hospital. • CUAMM in this quarter supported 51 obstetric boat referral cases to the Comprehensive Emergency Obstetric Care Service (CEmONC) with 37 boat referrals done to Bonthe Government Hospital and 14 to Pujehun Government Hospital. NEMS facilitated all the referrals done. From the SLiSL facilities 54 and 132 obstetric and pediatrics were done in Pujehun and 38 and 38 obstetric and pediatrics were done in Bonthe • RMNCHA and EmONC trainings conducted • In improving on reproductive and child health issue, this quarter CUAMM in collaboration with DHMT pujehun supported RMNCHA training on ANC and Patograph through using small groups clusters at chiefdon level to train 100 nursers directly dealing with obstretric for 96 health staff from 84 health facilities in Pujehun and 4 nurses from the maternity unit of Pujehun Government hospital • Mentorship on EmONC and IMNCI • Mentorship to support Reproductive, Maternal, New-born, Child Health & Adolescent (RMNCH) process started this reporting period. This time, assessment to ascertain benchmarks on the competency of both mentors and mentees were done and target is already set. • To ascertain mentee willingness, commitment and time to the mentorship frame work, 16 mentees from Pujehun and 12 from Bonthe signed a memorandum of Understanding to affirm their commitment to the mentorship process. • Clinical Mentors this period established a firm understanding on their mentees, environment and stake holder that support mentorship process. • After assessment of mentees, mentorship throught one on one coaching started for CUAMM district. On a weekly basis, mentors plan on different topics that weakness are identified on from metess as observed from the assessment completeec for each mentee. Regional Public health specialist has been directly supporting mentors on theis stratergy. Quality Improvement (QI) team as basis is been established in 28 health facilities and implementation of 5 S’s still in progress in mentorship facilities • Blood Donation Activities Supported • CUAMM support to blood drives for government hospital blood banks this quarter include: Pujehun Government Hospital was supported with 166 units of blood from community blood donation drive campaigns done in communities within Pujehun. Bonthe Government Hospital blood bank was supported with 43 units of blood and Mattru UBC hospital with 51 units of blood this quarter. • The drives are voluntary donation done by donors where they are rewarded with non-financial incentives like T-shirt, cooked food to replace energy, cookies, water and soft drinks. • DHMT/Hospital Operation support • CUAMM continued with its support on Fuel for Bothe DHMT and Hospital generator on working days for DHMT and 24-hourly basis for Hospital throughout the week. • Internet connectivity, provision of stationery, fuel support to DHMT vehicle on activity basis continued during this reporting period with no hinderance. Stationery for hospital, patient chart and referral forms, cleaning materials among other vital need of the hospital was supported to both Hospitals in CUAMM districts • Flexible fund supports • Supported on minor repairs for Motou CHC labor ward was done in Bonthe. Materials provided include examination couch and Post Natal Care (PNC) Was done in Bonthe district. Pujehun did support with antenatal care beds, postnatal beds, dispensary cupboards, wall shelves in two facilities in Pujehun this quarter • CUAMM supported DHMT/Nutrition Units of Pujehun and Bonthe to commemorate World Breastfeeding Week (WBW) in collaboration with Restless Development in SLiSL communities. This time there were lot of messaging on promotion of optimal breast feeding and other infant and young child feeding practices through Mother to Mother support group, radio discussions, CHWs and more • Others Activities completed • Chiefdom level CHO Supportive Supervision was done in 7 SLiSL Chiefdom in Pujehun and 5 in Bonthe. CUAMM supported two monthly CHO supervision in Bonthe and one in Pujehun. The supervision is a supportive one done by CHO supervisor where they will go and sit with health facility staff within their chiefdom to do supervision and minor coaching on data, Health facility forms clinical condition’s among others. • During this quarter, one-day training on strengthening the role of chiefdom supervisors to improve maternal and child health care and use of partograph was done to 14 CHOs in both districts. • During this quarter there were report of flash floods in Bonth Pujehun and Bonthe. CUAMM collaborated with DHMT and toehr partnenrs in response to the need of victims of the disasters
